block.p: LEAD: Americans put an estimated $31.5 billion into Individual Retirement Accounts by the 1989 tax filing deadline yesterday, Money magazine reports. The latest year's total is more than double the $15 billion added to I.R.A.'s in 1988 but lags well behind the record $50 billion invested in 1986, the year before Congress reduced the deductibility of contributions, the magazine said.

LEAD: Americans put an estimated $31.5 billion into Individual Retirement Accounts by the 1989 tax filing deadline yesterday, Money magazine reports. The latest year's total is more than double the $15 billion added to I.R.A.'s in 1988 but lags well behind the record $50 billion invested in 1986, the year before Congress reduced the deductibility of contributions, the magazine said.

Americans put an estimated $31.5 billion into Individual Retirement Accounts by the 1989 tax filing deadline yesterday, Money magazine reports. The latest year's total is more than double the $15 billion added to I.R.A.'s in 1988 but lags well behind the record $50 billion invested in 1986, the year before Congress reduced the deductibility of contributions, the magazine said. The total amount held in I.R.A.'s rose $72 billion in the last year, to $465 billion, Money said. Earnings from existing investments accounted for $40.5 billion of the increase.
